sen.j: 桂離宮（かつらりきゅう）は京都市西京区桂にある離宮（離宮とは皇居とは別に設けた宮殿の意）である。
sen.e: Katsura Rikyu is the detached Palace (the palace built apart from the Imperial Palace) located at Katsura, Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Katsura Rikyu is the detached Palace (a palace built apart from the Imperial Palace) located at Katsura, Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Katsura Rikyu is the detached Palace (a palace built apart from the Imperial Palace) located at Katsura, Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 江戸時代初期の造営当初の庭園と建築物を遺しており、当時の（王朝）文化の粋を今に伝えている。
sen.e: It retains the original garden and buildings from early Edo period when it was built, it passes the old-world elegance from that period (imperial dynasty) to the present.
It retains the original garden and buildings from early Edo period when it was built, it brubgs the old-world elegance from that period (imperial dynasty) to the present.
It retains the original garden and buildings from early Edo period when it was built, it brings the old-world elegance from that period (imperial dynasty) to the present.

sen.j: 回遊式の庭園は日本庭園の傑作とされる。
sen.e: It is called the circuit style garden was one of the classic of the Japanese garden.
It is called the circuit style garden and was one of the classical Japanese gardens.
It is called the circuit style garden and was one of the classical Japanese gardens.

sen.j: また、建築物のうち書院は書院造を基調に数寄屋風を採り入れている。
sen.e: Also the Shoin (a drawing room in the shoin style) out of other buildings is built in the style of a tea-ceremony hut (Sukiya), based on the traditional Japanese style of residential architecture that includes a tokonoma.

Also the Shoin (a drawing room in the shoin style) outside and separate from other buildings is built in the style of a tea-ceremony house (Sukiya), based upon the traditional Japanese style of residential architecture that includes a tokonoma.

Also the Shoin (a drawing room in the shoin style) outside and separate from other buildings is built in the style of a tea-ceremony house (Sukiya), based upon the traditional Japanese style of residential architecture that includes a tokonoma.

sen.j: 庭園には茶屋が配されている。
sen.e: There is a tea house in the garden.
There is a tea house in the garden.
There is a tea house in the garden.

sen.j: もとは桂宮家の別荘であった。
sen.e: Originally it was a resort villa of Katsura no Miya family.
Originally it was a resort villa belonging to the Katsura no Miya family.
Originally it was a resort villa belonging to the Katsura no Miya family.

sen.j: 宮内庁京都事務所により管理されている。
sen.e: It is under the supervision of Kyoto office of the Imperial Household Agency.
It is under the supervision of the Kyoto office of the Imperial Household Agency.
It is under the supervision of the Kyoto office of the Imperial Household Agency.

sen.j: 参観には宮内庁京都事務所に事前申込みが必要である（外部リンクの参観案内参照）。
sen.e: The booking is needed through the Kyoto office of the Imperial Household Agency to visit inside the building. (Please refer to the details of the information visiting buildings for outside link.)

Booking an appointment is required through the Kyoto office of the Imperial Household Agency in order to visit inside the building. (Please refer to the details of the information for visiting buildings link.)
sen.cmt: "buildings for outside" is a strange expession because all buildings are "outside" clarification is required here or just eliminate "outside" as I did.
sen.e: An appointment must be made through the Kyoto office of the Imperial Household Agency in order to visit the inside of the building. (Please click the external link below for information on visiting this building.)
sen.cmt: outsideはbuildingのことではなく、「外部リンク」の外部の意味です。外部リンクを自然な表現に修正し、全体を訳し直しました。

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 桂離宮は17世紀に八条宮家の別荘として造営されたもので、書院、茶屋、回遊式庭園から成る。
sen.e: The Katsura Rikyu was built as Hachijo no Miya family's villa in seventeen century, it consists of Shoin, tea house and circuit style garden.
The Katsura Rikyu was built as a villa for the Hachijo no Miya family in the seventeen century, it consists of Shoin, tea house, and circuit style garden.
The Katsura Rikyu was built as a villa for the Hachijo no Miya family in the seventeen century, it consists of Shoin, tea house, and circuit style garden.

sen.j: 近世の皇族の別荘の実態を伝えるものとして貴重である。
sen.e: This is a rare building which shows how the modern Imperial villa was built.
This is a rare building that shows how the modern Imperial villa was built.
This is a rare building that shows how the modern Imperial villa was built.

sen.j: 桂の地は、古くから貴族の別荘地として知られ、平安時代には藤原道長の別荘（当時は「別業」といった）が営まれていたという。
sen.e: The place of Katsura was known where the court noble's had villas from old days, and there used to be FUJIWARA no Michinaga's villa (it was called Betsugyo at that time instead of Besso,both means villa) run in the same place during the Heian period.

The place of Katsura was known for the court noble's villas from olden days, and there used to be a villa belonging to FUJIWARA no Michinaga (it was called Betsugyo at that time instead of Besso, both mean villa) in the same place during the Heian period.

The place of Katsura was known for the court noble's villas from olden days, and there used to be a villa belonging to FUJIWARA no Michinaga (it was called Betsugyo at that time instead of Besso, both mean villa) in the same place during the Heian period.

sen.j: また、この地は風流な観月の名所としても知られていた。
sen.e: This place is also known a good spot to see the moon in elegant way.
This place is also known a good spot to view the moon in an elegant way.
This place is also known a good spot to view the moon in an elegant way.

sen.j: 桂離宮の近くの西京区松室には月読神社があり、桂の地名も中国語の「月桂」の故事から来ているという。
sen.e: There is Tsukiyomi-jinja Shrine in Matsumuro Nishikyo Ward near Katsura Rikyu, the name of Katsura came from Chinese historical event, 'Gekkei (The Katsura tree on the moon)'.
sen.cmt: 月桂→the Katsura tree on the moon?[定訳不明]
sen.e: There is Tsukiyomi-jinja Shrine in Matsumuro Nishikyo Ward near Katsura Rikyu, the name of Katsura came from the Chinese historical event, 'Gekkei (The Katsura tree on the moon)'.
There is Tsukiyomi-jinja Shrine in Matsumuro Nishikyo Ward near Katsura Rikyu, the name of Katsura came from the Chinese historical event, 'Gekkei (The Katsura tree on the moon).'

sen.j: 桂離宮は八条宮家初代の智仁（としひと）親王（1579年 - 1629年）によって基礎が築かれた。
sen.e: The base of the Katsura Rikyu was established by the first Hachijo no Miya Imperial Prince Toshihito. (1579 - 1629)
The base of the Katsura Rikyu was established by the first Hachijo no Miya Imperial Prince Toshihito. (1579 - 1629)
The base of the Katsura Rikyu was established by the first Hachijo no Miya Imperial Prince Toshihito (1579 - 1629).

sen.j: 智仁親王は正親町天皇の皇孫、後陽成天皇の弟に当たる。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Toshihito was Emperor Ogimachi's grandchild, and a brother of Emperor Goyozei.
Imperial Prince Toshihito was Emperor Ogimachi's grandchild, and a brother of Emperor Goyozei.
Imperial Prince Toshihito was Emperor Ogimachi's grandchild, and a brother of Emperor Goyozei.

sen.j: 智仁親王は初め豊臣秀吉の猶子となったが、秀吉に実子が生まれたため、八条宮家を創設したものである。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Toshihito was adopted by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI initially, but after Hideyoshi had his own child, Toshihito established Hachijo no Miya family.
Imperial Prince Toshihito was initially adopted by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, but after Hideyoshi had his own child, Toshihito established the Hachijo no Miya family.
Imperial Prince Toshihito was initially adopted by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, but after Hideyoshi had his biological child, Toshihito established the Hachijo no Miya family.
sen.cmt: own child→biological childに変更しました。

sen.j: 桂離宮の書院は「古書院」「中書院」「新御殿」の3つの部分に分かれ、このうち古書院の建設は1615年頃と推定される。
sen.e: The Shoin of Katsura Rikyu separate into three sections, 'Kosho in', 'Chusho in' and 'Shin Goten', and the Kosho in was presumed to be built in 1615.
sen.cmt: 古書院, 中書院, 新御殿→ 読み方不明
sen.e: The Shoin of Katsura Rikyu separated into three sections, 'Kosho in', 'Chusho in' and 'Shin Goten', and the Kosho in was presumed to be built in 1615.
The Shoin of Katsura Rikyu separated into three sections, 'Kosho in,' 'Chusho in' and 'Shin Goten,' and the Kosho in was presumed to be built in 1615.

sen.j: 書院、茶屋、庭園などの造営は、八条宮家2代の智忠（としただ）親王（1619年 - 1662年）に引き継がれ、数十年間をかけて整備された。
sen.e: The building work of Shoin, tea house and the garden was passed to the second Hachijo no Miya Imperial Prince Toshitada (1619 - 1662), and the buildings were maintenance over ten years.
The construction work of the Shoin, tea house, and the garden was passed to the second Hachijo no Miya Imperial Prince Toshitada (1619 - 1662), and the buildings were maintained for over ten years.
The construction work of the Shoin, tea house, and the garden was passed to the second Hachijo no Miya Imperial Prince Toshitada (1619 - 1662), and the buildings were maintained for a few decades.

sen.j: 八条宮家は常磐井宮、京極宮、桂宮と名前を変えた後、1881年に断絶し、桂離宮は1883年から宮内省の管轄になった。
sen.e: The Hachijo no Miya family changed the name from Tokiwai no Miya, Kyogoku no Miya, Katsra no Miya, and the family was discontinued in 1881, after that it was under the supervision of the Department of the Imperial Household from 1883.

The Hachijo no Miya family changed their name from Tokiwai no Miya, Kyogoku no Miya, Katsra no Miya, and the family was discontinued in 1881, after that it came under the supervision of the Department of the Imperial Household from 1883.

The Hachijo no Miya family changed their name from Tokiwai no Miya, Kyogoku no Miya, Katsura no Miya, and the family was discontinued in 1881, after that it came under the supervision of the Department of the Imperial Household from 1883.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦後は、宮内庁が管理している。
sen.e: After the World WarⅡ, the Katsura Rikyu in under the supervision of the Department of the Imperial Household.
After the World War, the Katsura Rikyu in came under the supervision of the Department of the Imperial Household.
After the World War, the Katsura Rikyu came under the supervision of the Department of the Imperial Household.

sen.j: 建物と庭園
sen.e: The buildings and garden.
The buildings and garden.
The buildings and garden.

sen.j: 古書院、中書院、新御殿はいずれも入母屋造、柿葺（こけらぶき）で、書院造を基調としているが、古書院の縁側などには数寄屋風の要素も見られる。
sen.e: The Koshoin, Chusho in and Shingoten have building with a half-hipped roof (Irimoya zukuri) and roofed with shngles (Kokera buki) and all were built based on the traditional Japanese style of residential architecture that includes a tokonoma, there is a slight Sukiya style (a house built in the style of a tea-ceremony hut) being used in the narrow wooden passageway of Kosho in.

The Koshoin, Chusho in and Shingoten have buildings with a half-hipped roof (Irimoya zukuri) and is roofed with shngles (Kokera buki) and all were built based upon the traditional Japanese style of residential architecture that includes a tokonoma, there is a slight Sukiya style (a house built in the style of a tea-ceremony house) being used in the narrow wooden passageway of Kosho in.

The Kosho in, Chusho in and Shingoten have buildings with a half-hipped roof (Irimoya zukuri) and is roofed with shingles (Kokera buki) and all were built based upon the traditional Japanese style of residential architecture that includes a tokonoma, there is a slight Sukiya style (a house built in the style of a tea-ceremony house) being used in the narrow wooden passageway of Kosho in.
sen.cmt: スペース挿入スペルを修正

sen.j: 古書院縁側からさらに張り出した竹簀子（すのこ）のベランダ状のスペースは「月見台」と称され、桂離宮の主要テーマが観月にあることを示している。
sen.e: The veranda area coming out of the narrow wooden passageway of Kosho in, which is made of lattice, is called 'Tsukimidai' (the place to look at the moon), it tells you the main theme of Katsura Rikyu was to observe the moon.

The veranda area coming out of the narrow wooden passageway of Kosho in, which is made with a lattice, is called 'Tsukimidai' (the place to view the moon), it tells you that the main theme of Katsura Rikyu was to observe the moon.

The veranda area coming out of the narrow wooden passageway of Kosho in, which is made with a lattice, is called 'Tsukimidai' (the place to view the moon), it tells you that the main theme of Katsura Rikyu was to observe the moon.

sen.j: 中書院と新御殿の水墨画主体の障壁画は、江戸幕府御用絵師・狩野探幽一門によるものである。
sen.e: The wall painting based in sumi painting of Chusho in and the Shingoten was drawn by Tanno KANO's family who were patronized by the Edo bakufu. (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun)
The wall painting based on a sumi painting of Chusho in and the Shingoten was drawn by Tanno KANO's family who were patronized by the Edo bakufu. (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun)
The wall painting based on a sumi painting of Chusho in and the Shingoten was drawn by Tanno KANO's family who were patronized by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 新御殿上段の間の「桂棚」は天下三棚の一つとして知られる（他に修学院離宮、醍醐寺三宝院）。
sen.e: The 'Katsura dana', the upper part of Shingoten was known one of the Tenka sandana. (Other two are Shugakuin Rikyu (Imperial Villa) and Sanboin of Daigo-ji Temple.)
sen.cmt: 桂棚、天下三棚→ 読み方不明
sen.e: The 'Katsura dana', the upper part of the Shingoten was knownas one of the Tenka sandana. (Other two are the Shugakuin Rikyu (Imperial Villa) and the Sanboin of Daigo-ji Temple.)

The 'Katsura dana' in the Jodan no ma (a raised floor level on which the shogun and his retinue sat) of the Shingoten was known as one of the Tenka sandana (three greatest shelves). (The other two are located at the Shugakuin Rikyu [Imperial Villa] and the Sanboin of Daigo-ji Temple.)
sen.cmt: コンマの位置移動スペース挿入「天下三棚」に英語の説明を加えました。the upper part→in the Jodan no ma (a raised floor level on which the shogun and his retinue sat) 天下三棚は(three greatest shelves)くらいでいいのではないかと思います。I'm still not sure how a raised floor can be referred to as a shelf... And I have assumed that the other two great shelves (whatever they may be) are located at the two places mentioned (the original seemed to be saying that these two places were shelves, which would make no sense to me at all). By the way, the additonal information provided by the checker about the meaning of "Jodan no ma" is great!

sen.j: 回遊式庭園には、桂川の水を引いた池を中心に、茶屋、築山、州浜、橋、石灯篭などを配している。
sen.e: There are a pond in the centre of the circuit style garden, which the water come from Katsura river, surrounded by a tea room, a mound, a sandy beach, a bridge and a stone lantern.
There is a pond in the centre of the circuit style garden, and the water comes from the Katsura river, surrounded by a tea room, a mound, a sandy beach, a bridge and a stone lantern.
There is a pond in the center of the circuit style garden, and the water comes from the Katsura river, surrounded by a tea room, a mound, a sandy beach, a bridge and a stone lantern.

sen.j: 茶屋は松琴亭（しょうきんてい）、賞花亭（しょうかてい）、笑意軒（しょういけん）、月波楼（げっぱろう）の4棟があり、他に持仏堂の園林堂（おんりんどう）がある。
sen.e: There are four buildings in tea house, Shokintei, Shokatei, Shoiken and Gepparo, there is also another one called Onrindo.
There are four types of tea houses, Shokintei, Shokatei, Shoiken, and Gepparo, there is also another one called Onrindo.
There are four types of tea houses, Shokintei, Shokatei, Shoiken, and Gepparo, there is also a jibutsu-do hall (the private Buddha statue hall) called Onrindo.
sen.cmt: another one→jibutsu-do hall (the private Buddha statue hall)

sen.j: 評価
sen.e: The estimation
The estimation
The estimation

sen.j: 昭和始めにドイツから亡命したブルーノ・タウトが「泣きたくなるほど美しい」と絶賛し、装飾を排した簡素な建築美はモダニズム建築の造形美にも通じるとして評価された。
sen.e: Bruno Taut who defected from Germany in early Showa period, mentioned about Katsura Rikyu, 'It makes me almost cry as it is so beautiful', the simple beauty of the building without having any decoration was estimated same value as the modern beauty of architectural modeling.

Bruno Taut, who defected from Germany in the early Showa period, mentioned about Katsura Rikyu, 'It makes me almost cry, it is so beautiful', the simple beauty of the building without having any decorations was estimated to have the same value as the beauty seen in modern architectural modeling.

Bruno Taut, who defected from Germany in the early Showa period, mentioned about Katsura Rikyu, 'It makes me almost cry, it is so beautiful,' the simple beauty of the building without having any decorations was estimated to have the same value as the beauty seen in modern architectural modeling.

sen.j: 同時代の建築である日光東照宮と対比されることも多い。
sen.e: It often being compared with Nikko Tosho-gu Shrine which was built in the same period.
It is often being compared with Nikko Tosho-gu Shrine which was built during the same period.
It is often being compared with Nikko Tosho-gu Shrine which was built during the same period.
